intro: Senecio streptanthifolius var. oodes, commonly known as the Oodes Senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and sometimes covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. This variety is often found in open vegetation and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
